main event: A sighting of a bright, flashing, bluish-white, circular object that was hovering and then moving in a northerly direction over Allentown, Pennsylvania on June 5, 1965.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be at an altitude of 500 to 1,000 feet.
The object was observed for approximately 30 minutes.
The report mentions that the object's description and a witness sketch were attached, but these were not included in the provided text.
The Air Force requested additional details from the witness, including the total duration of the sighting, variations in the object's apparent speed, and information about the curved trajectory.
The report indicates that the observed trajectory may have been a fireball, but the witness's statement that the object was perfectly round contradicts this hypothesis.
sighted object: a bright, flashing, bluish-white, circular object
